name.namePart: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio

extension.cause: 28:2254 Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus (State)

titleInfo.title: Call v. Jeffries
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum Opinion and Order. The petitioner has filed re 9 Ex parte motion to supeona [sic] Stenographer's record, including the transcripts and cryptographic dictations. This court does not accept ex parte motions. Therefore the motion will be denied, without prejudice to renewal if and when served upon respondent's counsel. If petitioner chooses to do so, he need not resubmit the present pleading. A certificate of service documenting that the motion as tendered was served upon respondent's counsel will suffice. Signed by Magistrate Judge David S. Perelman on 1/20/06. (W, Jo)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio
extension.docketText: Memorandum Opinion and Order. The petitioner has filed re 9 Ex parte motion to supeona [sic] Stenographer's record, including the transcripts and cryptographic dictations. This court does not accept ex parte motions. Therefore the motion will be denied, without prejudice to renewal if and when served upon respondent's counsel. If petitioner chooses to do so, he need not resubmit the present pleading. A certificate of service documenting that the motion as tendered was served upon respondent's counsel will suffice. Signed by Magistrate Judge David S. Perelman on 1/20/06. (W, Jo)

titleInfo.title: Call v. Jeffries
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum Opinion and Order. Upon examiniation of the file in this action in habeas corpus it appears that no response has been filed on behalf of the respondent. This Court, therefore, communicated with the appropriate division of the Attorney General's office, and was adivised that they do not have a copy of the petiton. Whether the breakdown resulting in this occurred with this Court or with the Attorney General is unknown. This Court, therefore, directs that another copy of the petition be forwarded directly to Ms. Diane Mallory at the Attorney General's Office, and extends the period for the filing of response to March 17, 2006. Signed by Magistrate Judge David S. Perelman on 1/26/06. (W, Jo)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio

This Court, therefore, communicated with the appropriate division of the Attorney General's office, and was adivised that they do not have a copy of the petiton. Whether the breakdown resulting in this occurred with this Court or with the Attorney General is unknown. This Court, therefore, directs that another copy of the petition be forwarded directly to Ms. Diane Mallory at the Attorney General's Office, and extends the period for the filing of response to March 17, 2006. Signed by Magistrate Judge David S. Perelman on 1/26/06. (W, Jo)

titleInfo.title: Call v. Jeffries
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum Opinion and Order. Signed by Magistrate Judge David S. Perelman on 11/27/06 (so). (W, Jo)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio
extension.docketText: Memorandum Opinion and Order. Signed by Magistrate Judge David S. Perelman on 11/27/06 (so). (W, Jo)

titleInfo.title: Call v. Jeffries
titleInfo.subTitle: Report and Recommended Decision. It is recommended that the petitioner's first, fourth, sixth through eleventh and thirteenth claims for relief be dismissed as procedurally defaulted; that the remaining portion of his first, and his second, third, fifth, twelfth and fourteenth claims for relief be denied on the merits; and that the petition be dismissed without further proceedings. Signed by Magistrate Judge David S. Perelman on 11/27/06. (W, Jo)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio
extension.docketText: Report and Recommended Decision. It is recommended that the petitioner's first, fourth, sixth through eleventh and thirteenth claims for relief be dismissed as procedurally defaulted; that the remaining portion of his first, and his second, third, fifth, twelfth and fourteenth claims for relief be denied on the merits; and that the petition be dismissed without further proceedings. Signed by Magistrate Judge David S. Perelman on 11/27/06. (W, Jo)

titleInfo.title: Call v. Jeffries
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum of Opinion and Order that: The Court overrules Petitioner's objections and adopts the Magistrate Judge's Report and Recommendation in full. Consequently, the petition for writ of habeas corpus is denied. Signed by Judge Dan Aaron Polster on 1/5/2007. (Related doc 30)(B, B)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio
